Detailed Description

A plError is an exception thrown when a fatal error is encountered in ProBT.

Every kind of plError has an integer code accessible with get_error_number(). It can be output to a stream or a string by using operator<<(); in addition to the error code, this output contains a human-readable description of the error.

When thrown, a plError prints itself to the standard error output. This behaviour can be disabled globally by using plError::always_display() or for a given error number by using plError::ignore_this_message().

Member Function Documentation

static void plError::abort_in_warning ( bool  wie_flag)
inlinestatic

Makes all warnings (ignored or not, displayed or not) call abort().

Parameters
wie_flagWhether to call abort() when the warning is raised (true), or just display it and go on with execution (false).

This method is obsolete, use treat_warnings_as_errors() instead.

static void plError::always_display ( bool  display_flag)
static

Set the global display flag for errors.

When true, all errors will be displayed as soon as they are created. When false, they will not be displayed. In all cases, errors are C++ exceptions: you may catch them using try and catch, and inspect them using what() and get_error_number().

Parameters
display_flagNew value of the global display flag.
static void plError::always_display_warning ( bool  display_flag)
static

Inhibits the display of all warnings.

Parameters
display_flagWhether to hide all warnings (false) or display all those that are not ignored (true).
void plError::display ( std::ostream &  out = std::cerr) const
inline

Same as Output().

Could probably be deprecated, and then removed.

References plObject::Output().

unsigned int plError::get_error_number ( ) const

Returns the error number.

static void plError::ignore_this_message ( unsigned int  id_message,
bool  ignoring_state 
)
static

Inhibits the display of a warning or error, given its number.

This is useful if you are sure that a given warning is not pertinent in your particular setting. This function has no effect if the given message number is invalid.

Parameters
id_messageNumber of the warning or error to ignore.
ignoring_stateWhether to ignore the message (true), or display it (false).
static const std::string plError::main_msg ( unsigned int  error_id)
staticprotected

Return the message for the given error id.

static bool plError::message_is_ignored ( unsigned int  id_message)
static

Tells whether a warning or error is currently ignored.

This will return true unless a warning/error is specifically ignored ; calls to always_display_warning() and always_display() have no influence on the return of this function. This function returns false if the given message number is invalid.

Parameters
id_messageNumber of the warning or error.
Returns
true if and only if the warning is currently ignored.
static void plError::set_output_stream ( std::ostream *  outstream)
inlinestatic

Changes the output stream in which errors and warings are displayed.

The default one is std::cerr.

static void plError::treat_this_warning_as_error ( unsigned int  id_warning,
bool  wae_flag = true 
)
static

Makes the warning with id id_warning (ignored or not, displayed or not) raise an exception.

Parameters
id_warningNumber of the warning.
wae_flagWhether to raise an exception when the warning is raised (true), or just display it and go on with execution (false).
static void plError::treat_warnings_as_errors ( bool  wie_flag = true)
static

Makes all warnings (ignored or not, displayed or not) raise an exception.

Parameters
wie_flagWhether to raise an exception when the warning is raised (true), or just display it and go on with execution (false).
static void plError::warn ( unsigned int  error_id)
static

Prints a ProBT warning.

Normally, this is not fatal. However, warnings can be made fatal globally by calling

plError::abort_in_warning(true);
Parameters
error_idNumber of the warning to raise.

Referenced by plLearnObject::learn().

static void plError::warn ( unsigned int  error_id,
const std::string &  additional_info 
)
static

Prints a ProBT warning with additional information.

Normally, this is not fatal. However, warnings can be made fatal globally by calling

plError::abort_in_warning(true);
Parameters

additional_infoAdditional information that details the warning.
